My heartfelt prayers to the families of the Americans killed near Bagram. I condemn this disgusting terrorist act. U.S. service members have sacrificed their lives in Afghanistan to keep us safe and no cowardly act of terror will impede our efforts to achieve peace.

Joined@BretBaier on@SpecialReport to discuss the announcement of our intent to designate IRGC as a Foreign Terrorist Organization. The reality is: there can be no peace and security in the Middle East without weakening the IRGC. https://youtu.be/KApTReUI64I.

The use of terrorism is central to the Iranian regime’s foreign policy. The designation of IRGC, incl. Qods Force, will help starve the regime of the means to execute this destructive policy. Maximum pressure will be unrelenting until Iran’s regime abandons its deadly ambitions.

In an important step to counter the Iranian regime’s terrorism, the U.S. has designated the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, incl. Qods Force, as a Foreign Terrorist Organization. We must help the people of Iran get back their freedom.

Venezuela’s health system is collapsing due to the disastrous policies of a corrupt and brutal former Maduro regime. But the interim government under@JGuaido is responding to the people’s needs with health & hygiene fairs throughout #Venezuela. #EstamosUnidosVE.

It was a pleasure to see #Poland’s Foreign Minister Jacek Czaputowicz who is in Washington for@NATO #ForMin. We discussed the #WarsawProcess, our hope for a brighter future in the Middle East, and our intention to announce updates on the working groups soon.@PolandMFA.
Thank you to our@NATO Allies who joined me in Washington this week. Through our continued cooperation, NATO will stand as the bulwark of international peace into the future.

As we celebrate #NATO70, we honor an Alliance that has been and still is the bulwark of international peace and security. The U.S. affirms our unconditional support for@NATO and Article 5. Together, we are #AlliedStrong.

Today’s meetings demonstrate the continued value of #NATO70. Our Alliance is strong, but must adapt to new challenges & invest in necessary capabilities, including the protection of 5G technology. I call on all of our #Allies to continue making progress toward their Wales Pledge.

Honored to welcome our #Allies to Washington for the@NATO #ForMin. This year we celebrate 70 years of transatlantic cooperation and I look forward to discussing how we can strengthen our Alliance for future generations.

Pleased to welcome Morgan Ortagus as our new@statedeptspox. Her experience as an intelligence analyst & public affairs officer in foreign policy & national security will benefit America. She'll lead our fight to communicate & defend US foreign policy. Welcome to our team Morgan.

I am confident with the actions of our team at@StateSPEHA and our partners in other branches of government, that these families are not alone in the mission to achieve freedom for every American hostage. As Americans, we are family – and we will never abandon our people.

It was an honor to speak yesterday with the families of American citizens held captive abroad. I told them@StateDept & the@realDonaldTrump Administration carry their loved ones in our hearts, and we are committed to doing our very best every day to bring their loved ones home.

I’ve long admired Senator Bob Dole as an inspiring leader and a truly great American. I’m proud to salute my friend, a fellow Kansan and@USArmy officer, on his promotion to Colonel. Congratulations,@SenatorDole!

Spoke today at the@ArmyWarCollege about the undeniable connection between American service members and American diplomats. If we do our job right as diplomats at the@StateDept, we can keep the men and women serving in our armed forces out of harm’s way.
Great conversation today with@StateDept colleagues. We discussed a range of topics and shared a few laughs. Always a pleasure meeting the hard-working patriots of the State Department.
On behalf of the@StateDept family, we thank@HeatherNauert for her service and two years of unequalled excellence. You will represent America well on the Fulbright board!@FulbrightPrgrm@ECAatState.
On this #VietnamWarVeteransDay, we honor and salute the men and women who served during the Vietnam War. Thank you and your families for the service and sacrifice on behalf of our nation.

Proud to have students from over 20 Historically Black Colleges and Universities attend@StateDept's 10th Annual #HBCU Foreign Policy Conference today. Students had the opportunity to hear from State Department employees about the important work of diplomacy.

Congratulations to@jensstoltenberg on his extension as@NATO Secretary General. His exemplary leadership and the support from our Allies shows that together, we are #AlliedStrong and I look forward to personally welcoming him to Washington to celebrate #NATO70.

Maduro calls for hands off #Venezuela while he invites security forces from Cuba and Russia, so he and his cronies can keep plundering Venezuela. It is time for Venezuelan institutions to stand for their sovereignty. Russia and Cuba, #HandsOffVenezuela.

Staff Sgt. Travis W. Atkins’ heroic actions during Operation Iraqi Freedom saved three lives, but cost him his. Today, he is posthumously awarded the #MedalofHonor, and we remember his legacy of bravery and selflessness.

Had an opportunity to discuss the 2020@StateDept and@USAID budget with Congress today. This budget request will help us achieve our key diplomatic goals with China, Russia, Venezuela, Iran, and help our allies and partners become more secure and economically self-reliant.

The world cannot afford China’s shameful hypocrisy toward Muslims. On one hand, China abuses more than a million Muslims at home, but on the other it protects violent Islamic terrorist groups from sanctions at the UN.

China has detained more than one million #Uighurs, ethnic #Kazakhs, and other #Muslim minorities in internment camps in #Xinjiang since April 2017. The U.S. stands with them and their family members. China must release all those arbitrarily detained and end its repression.

Met with survivors and family members of China's campaign of repression and mass detention against #Uighurs, ethnic #Kazakhs, and other members of minority groups in #Xinjiang. I call on China to end these counterproductive policies and release all arbitrarily detained.

We condemn the attack on@JGuaido’s caravan and the reported harassment of@AsambleaVE members & deputies & journalists. Maduro and his colectivos only know intimidation. But democracy cannot be intimidated. #EstamosUnidosVE.

Today,@USTreasury took action against a network of front companies used by the Iranian regime to transfer a billion+ dollars and euros to the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps in an effort to evade U.S. sanctions. We'll continue to deny Iran the funds to fuel its terror machine.

In light of the evidence of abortion-related advocacy by an organ of@OAS_official, the U.S. will reduce our contributions to OAS equaling our estimated share of OAS spending on abortion activities. OAS should focus on the crises in Cuba, Nicaragua and Venezuela, not abortion.

American taxpayer money will not be used to underwrite abortions. We’ll continue to refuse to assist foreign NGOs who perform or promote abortions, as well as give financial support to other foreign groups in the global abortion industry. We’ll protect the least among us.

Pleased to welcome Stuart McGuigan as the new@StateDept CIO. With his experience at the helm of multinational corporations and deep knowledge of tech, he will provide the leadership, expertise, and commitment to service that will drive the digital transformation of diplomacy.
Anti-Zionism is anti-Semitism. #AIPAC2019.

We will not grow weary of this fight. Israel should be admired, not attacked, embraced, not vilified. I’m proud to lead American diplomacy to support Israel’s right to defend itself, stand with the Jewish people, and champion the perennial cause of religious liberty. #AIPAC2019.

The rise of anti-Semitism & anti-Zionism strikes at the very foundation of freedom. The Trump Administration opposes it unequivocally & will fight it relentlessly, from the fever swamp of the UN Human Rights Council to the world’s #1 proponent of anti-Semitism: Iran. #AIPAC2019.

It was my pleasure to speak to #AIPAC2019 today. My message was not only to reaffirm the essentiality of the U.S.-Israel relationship, but also that the U.S. stands with the Jewish people and Israel in the fight against the world’s oldest bigotry: anti-Semitism.

Honored to accompany President@realDonaldTrump and PM@netanyahu for the signing of the Proclamation declaring the #GolanHeights as part of Israel. Israel’s sovereignty over the Golan Heights is critical to its security and the stability of the entire Middle East.

Just got back from Kuwait, Israel, and Lebanon. Strengthened our security, counterterrorism, and economic partnerships. Discussed ways to increase pressure on Iran to change its destabilizing behavior, and promote religious tolerance in the region. Memorable week.

The territory ISIS once held in Iraq and Syria has been liberated. We congratulate the US military, SDF, and the@coalition on this incredible achievement. There is much work left to do to ensure the threat from radical Islamic terrorism is fully and finally defeated. #DefeatISIS.

President@realDonaldTrump promised to destroy ISIS’ fraudulent caliphate and he delivered on that today. Read his statement here on the territorial defeat, now 100% complete, and his commitment to ensure this evil won’t return.

Very successful visit to Beirut. Thank you to the Lebanese people for your world-famous hospitality. The U.S. remains committed to working with you to advance Lebanon’s stability, security, and prosperity.

The goal of the DETOUR Act is simple: instill a little transparency in what remains a very opaque market and make sure that consumers are able to make more informed choices about how and when to share their personal information.
It would also require informed consent for behavioral experimentation on users and prohibit user design intended to create compulsive usage among children under 13 years of age.

The Deceptive Experiences to Online Users Reduction (DETOUR) Act aims to curb dark patterns by prohibiting the largest online platforms (> 100 million monthly active users) from relying on user interfaces that intentionally impair user autonomy, decision-making, or choice.
I think folks have a right to know if social media companies are using them as guinea pigs, and especially if you’re being emotionally manipulated by an experiment.

For example, it was reported in 2014 that Facebook conducted an experiment involving nearly 700,000 users to study the emotional impact of manipulating information on their News Feeds https://www.forbes.com/sites/gregorymcneal/2014/06/28/facebook-manipulated-user-news-feeds-to-create-emotional-contagion/#2e10be3139dc ….

These design tactics, drawn from extensive behavioral psychology research, are frequently used by social media platforms to mislead consumers into agreeing to settings and practices advantageous to the company.

Case in point: privacy settings that push users to ‘agree’ as the default option, while users looking for more privacy-friendly options often must click through a much longer process, detouring through multiple screens.

Some of these #DarkPatterns, like the fake hairs, may just cause some minor inconvenience. But too often, large social media platforms have relied on all sorts of tricks to convince users to hand over their personal data without really understanding what they are consenting to.
This one might take the cake: using fake hairs or smudges to trick people into clicking mobile ads.
Using drop-down sections or discolored text to hide information or opt-in checkboxes? Yep, #DarkPatterns.
Can you tell which of these buttons is a legitimate download link and which ones are ads? Your guess is as good as mine. “Disguised Ads” are another type of dark pattern.

Pop-ups like this one that force you to click one of the buttons in order to access the website is another example of a dark pattern. Ditto for “confirshaming” techniques like this, which guilt users into taking an action like signing up for a company’s email list.
I don’t know about you, but I hate it when I go to buy something online, only to see the price jump right as I’m about to check out. Those hidden costs are another type of dark pattern.
Ever run into a bunch of contradictory checkboxes that try to trick you into signing up for someone’s email list? That’s a dark pattern.
These techniques range from mildly annoying to deeply insidious. Here are some examples of #DarkPatterns you may have seen online:.

You might not have heard of a “dark pattern,” but chances are you’ve seen these annoying, manipulative designs trying to trick you into clicking, buying, or signing up for something you don’t want. Today I introduced the DETOUR Act with@SenatorFischer to do something about them.

No more excuses, let's release the Mueller report and let the American people judge the facts for themselves https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1rmGPeLWyLLJN ….

I'm on the Senate floor, trying to pass a resolution demanding the release of the Mueller report — the same resolution that passed the House on a bipartisan 420-0 vote https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1rmGPeLWyLLJN ….

The House passed the Mueller report resolution unanimously, 420-0. Today I’ll be calling on the Senate to do the same. It’s time to release the Mueller report.
 
Tune in at 1:00 PM https://youtu.be/I20i6vbzLSI.
But there’s something that we can do right now to close the wage gap for women all across the country: pass the #PaycheckFairnessAct.
With a complicated problem, there will not be one easy fix — ideas like making childcare more affordable and reversing long-standing cultural biases should all be part of the solution.

There are two ways to approach this issue: either we accept this inequity as a fact of life, or we look for ways to change it. For my part, I refuse to accept the notion that women should earn eighty cents — or less — on the dollar compared to their average male counterpart.
Here's a chart that really drives the point home https://twitter.com/axios/status/1113050973411344384 ….

We know that the gender pay gap exists all across the economy, stemming from a number of factors including discrimination, implicit bias, barriers to entry and advancement in certain fields, and the responsibilities of parenting that disproportionately fall to women.

Let’s also recognize that this disparity is even greater for women of color. #EqualPayDay for Black women will fall on August 22nd, followed by Native American women on September 23rd, and Latino women on November 20th.

On average, women are paid eighty cents on the dollar compared to their male counterparts. In Virginia, that number is $0.78. It’s not right, and we need to do more to achieve #EqualPay across the country. Let’s start by passing the #PaycheckFairnessAct. #EqualPayDay.
NATIONAL CHAMPS!! So proud of@UVAMensHoops and Coach Bennett!
Wahoowa! Look Hoos going to the national championship!
We need to do more to bring home the Americans wrongly detained in Iran https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2019/04/05/trump-pompeo-are-failing-american-hostages-iran/ ….

And my final question: Who in the US is benefiting from all this?

I’m going to keep pushing until we get answers to these questions.

13/13.

All of this leads me to ask: Why should we help Saudi Arabia in a disastrous war in Yemen? Why do we turn a blind eye to Saudi human rights abuses? Why would we transfer nuclear know-how and plot for a deal with Saudi Arabia, possibly sparking an arms race in the Middle East? 12/.

And additional reporting connects disgraced National Security Advisor Michael Flynn—convicted for lying about his ties and communications with foreign governments—to the push for a Saudi nuclear deal. 11 https://www.vox.com/world/2019/2/19/18231812/saudi-arabia-nuclear-flynn-trump-democrats ….
Remember, Jared Kushner was initially denied a security clearance in the White House due to concerns about foreign influence and personal financial conflicts. 10/.

And beyond just the timing—who is getting these secret approvals? One major nuclear firm, Westinghouse, is owned by the same investors who bailed Jared Kushner out of a bad real estate deal. 9 https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/02/opinion/sunday/saudi-arabia-jared-kushner-nuclear.html ….

In a hearing last week, I specifically asked Secretary Perry whether the secret approvals of nuclear information transfer occurred before or after the October 2018 murder of Jamal Khashoggi. He claimed not to know. 8/.

We know that Saudi Arabia is intent on building a nuclear program—but they haven’t agreed to the non-proliferation rules that would prevent the development of nuclear weapons. So it's only logical that Congress wants to know more about these approvals. 7/.

Then last week, we learned that the Trump administration has approved *secret transfers of nuclear technical information* from American companies to Saudi Arabia on 7 occasions. These transfers have been public in the past. Why are they secret now? When did they happen? 6/.

You would think the US would be up in arms about these horrors. But the Trump administration won’t stand up to Saudi Arabia. The President refuses to even submit a report determining whether or not Khashoggi's murder was a human rights violation. 5 https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/08/us/politics/trump-khashoggi-congress.html ….

In addition to the brutal murder of Jamal Khashoggi, Saudi Arabia has been arresting civil rights activists—including Virginia residents Salah al-Haider and his mother Aziza al-Youssef—simply for advocating for women’s rights! 4/.

Virginia resident and journalist Jamal Khashoggi criticized Saudi policy in Yemen. For his advocacy against the war, the government of Saudi Arabia lured him into their consulate in Istanbul and then tortured and assassinated him, dismembering his body with a bone saw. 3/.

The Yemen Civil War has been a humanitarian disaster, and Saudi intervention has made it worse. The US should NOT be involved. 2 https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2018/world/yemen-civil-war-women-children/?utm_term=.2bef65afad06 ….

This week, the House passed a Senate resolution ordering the President to stop US military support for Saudi Arabia’s intervention in Yemen’s Civil War. The bill now goes to the WH where Trump is likely to veto—then Congress would need to vote to override. So what’s at stake? 1/.

Salah al-Haidar—a Virginia resident and son of women’s rights activist Aziza al-Youssef—has been arrested by Saudi Arabia. This is the latest in Saudi Arabia’s appalling human rights violations, yet the Trump administration continues to turn a blind eye https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/saudi-arabia-arrests-8-more-activists-including-us-citizen/2019/04/04/591a051c-5756-11e9-aa83-504f086bf5d6_story.html?utm_term=.a602cefd9c5f ….

As Winston Churchill famously said: “There is only one thing worse than fighting with allies, and that is fighting without them.”

This is why I will always stand with NATO https://twitter.com/prashantrao/status/1113770030611804160 ….

UPDATE: The House just passed this resolution to end U.S. involvement in Yemen.

I strongly urge the President to sign it as quickly as possible. It's an unauthorized war—and it's causing utter devastation for millions of innocent people https://twitter.com/timkaine/status/1105591620777492481 ….
@MichaelBennet is a public servant I admire and one of my closest friends in the Senate. Wishing him and his family well https://twitter.com/MichaelBennet/status/1113637556284002304 ….

We authorized $700 million in student loan forgiveness for public servants like firefighters, teachers, and nurses. 

Now we’re learning that fewer than 300 people have actually received it. 

What is going on?? This administration is maddening https://www.washingtonpost.com/education/2019/04/03/education-dept-rejects-vast-majority-applicants-temporary-student-loan-forgiveness-program/ ….

Puerto Rico is part of the United States, period. And just like Americans in Florida, North Carolina, and Virginia, Puerto Ricans need disaster relief support. We want to treat American citizens all the same—and Republicans ought to want that too.

Say it with me, folks: More options, lower costs!

We know what people want when it comes to health care. I’ve heard it time and time again. With Medicare-X, we can do it https://www.politico.com/story/2019/03/29/bennet-kaine-medicare-health-care-1243267 ….

We absolutely have to work harder for fair pay for all women. That work includes passing the Paycheck Fairness Act ASAP — when we do, wages will be more transparent, and companies won't be able to punish those who fight against gender-based pay discrimination.

Today is #EqualPayDay, marking how long into the year women, on average, need to work in order to earn what men earned last year. For black women, Equal Pay Day isn't until August 22. For Latinas, Equal Pay Day is November 20. Imagine how this disparity adds up over a lifetime.

While Trump focuses on taking health care away from millions of Americans, we’re focused on making health care more accessible and affordable. Medicare-X is a way for people to get the care they need, at a cost they can handle.

Medicare-X is built on the existing Medicare framework and it includes the critical health benefits established in the ACA, like maternity care and mental health services, while also ensuring access to affordable prescription drugs.

Today@MichaelBennet and I are really proud to introduce Medicare-X, a public health care plan that brings down premiums and creates more options for folks who need coverage. The ACA was a great start — but too many Americans still can’t afford care.
GO HOOS https://twitter.com/dailyprogress/status/1112189692244606976 ….

He spent 2 years writing this report—Trump’s AG spent 2 days reviewing it. I, for one, would like to see it for myself.
Release the full report. Let the findings be out there for all to see. The American people deserve it. Our democracy deserves it.

16 years ago this week, the Iraq War began. 

What followed was years upon years of devastating loss of life.

Today, Iraq is a partner in our fight against terror. So why does the war authorization remain in place?

We need to repeal it. We should not be a nation at endless war.
And as we mark the new year, I call on the Iranian government to release all Americans wrongfully imprisoned on groundless charges so they can come home and reunite with their loved ones.

Speaker (aka “coach”) Mike Busch’s passing is a terrible loss for Maryland. Under his leadership, we have become a more inclusive and just community with greater opportunity for all. I was proud to call him a friend. Katherine and I send our deepest condolences to his family.

Speaker Mike Busch has always stood with Maryland and Maryland stands with Mike and his family during this heart-wrenching time. Our prayers and gratitude go out to Mike, Cindy, and his entire family at this difficult hour.

Last weekend, I attended the Smith Island Shoreline Restoration Dedication in Rhodes Point. The residents of the island worked nonstop to rebuild after Hurricane Sandy. I will continue to support projects to help sustain this resilient community.

New polling finds that the majority of voters don’t trust Trump on health care. And why would they? Republicans have never been serious about protecting access to coverage. They’re determined to tear down the ACA, but have no plan of their own. Expose the fraud—keep fighting! https://twitter.com/POLITICOPress/status/1113943328796680197 ….

51 years ago today, Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in Memphis. Let us use this day to honor his legacy and remember that “the ultimate tragedy is not the oppression and cruelty by the bad people but the silence over that by the good people.” #MLK51.

The House just reauthorized the Violence Against Women Act. Next up: the Senate. If Mitch McConnell refuses to bring it up, we’ll know he stands with the gun lobby over victims of domestic and sexual abuse. It’s not that hard—do your job https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/house-backs-new-version-of-violence-against-women-act-with-expansion-of-gun-control/2019/04/04/29b011f4-5616-11e9-814f-e2f46684196e_story.html?utm_term=.039322afd4c5 ….

Domestic abusers should not have guns. Yet the NRA is trying to block the reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act and protect abusers. What will McConnell do when this bill comes to the Senate? Stand up for the gun lobby or victims of domestic and sexual violence https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1112754016251985921 ….

Under the Trump Administration, the@EPA has been losing credibility on a daily basis. When top officials hide information about climate change and remove technical experts from its advisory process, it harms the public health. We must expose this abuse.

Mitch McConnell’s decision to tear up the Senate rules to pack the courts with ideologically extreme justices is a gross abuse of power. Senate Republicans will live to regret this. See you at the ballot box.

One clear message we can take away from the Mueller report—along with the consensus of our intelligence chiefs—is that Russia undermined our elections in 2016. As 2020 approaches, we must be vigilant and pass the #DETERAct to prevent future efforts to manipulate our democracy.

On #EqualPayDay,@PattyMurray asked unanimous consent to bring up the Paycheck Fairness Act—which the House passed last week. Senate Republicans objected. We will keep demanding a vote because there is no good reason to deny women equal pay for equal work.

I’m joining Democrats in introducing a resolution to reverse the Trump Justice Department’s cruel attempt to strike down the entire Affordable Care Act. Marylanders—including 975,000 living with a pre-existing condition—cannot afford to lose this fight https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/house-vote-tuesday-condemning-trumps-renewed-effort-repeal/story?id=62090459 ….

It is unacceptable for our service members—at Fort Meade, Aberdeen Proving Ground, or anywhere—to be subject to health, safety, or environmental hazards in their own homes. That’s why I’m fighting to include our bill, Ensuring Safe Housing for our Military Act, in the FY20 NDAA.

We introduced the Henrietta Lacks Enhancing Cancer Research Act, which will recognize her incredible story and work to ensure that all people—especially those from marginalized communities—are represented in cancer trials and get the treatment they deserve.

I’m proud that the Maryland General Assembly voted to name June 28th “Freedom of the Press Day” to honor Gerald, Rob, John, Rebecca, and Wendi. A free press is crucial to our democracy and those who call them “enemy of the people” embolden dictators and put journalists in danger https://twitter.com/capgaznews/status/1111255644009578496 ….

I have been urging this step for over a year and salute the Pentagon for making this decision to protect our national security and that of our allies. Now Congress needs to pass the bill I introduced with@SenatorLankford,@SenatorShaheen, and@SenThomTillis to lock this in https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1112787207876698114 ….

President Trump asked Congress to cut funding for the@SpecialOlympics in his past three budgets. And he's just now realizing this is happening? How far we have fallen—from Truman's "the buck stops here" to a president who has no idea what's going on—and takes no responsibility https://twitter.com/jameshohmann/status/1111633240480206849 ….

This #VietnamWarVeteransDay, we pay tribute to all who served there, including over 104,000 Marylanders. But words are not enough. A grateful nation must support those who sacrifice for our country. We've worked on a bipartisan basis to do so, but there is more to be done.

This is welcome news, but it is only a short-term solution. We must keep fighting to give both DED and TPS recipients the certainty and security their families deserve. It’s time to pass the SECURE Act once and for all https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-immigration-liberia/trump-extends-liberians-protected-immigration-status-by-one-year-idUSKCN1R92EC ….

Some good news for federal workers! After far too long of a delay, the modest cost of living increase that we secured for our civil servants as part of the government funding package is officially in place—retroactive as of January 1st https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/436324-trump-approves-pay-raise-for-federal-workers ….

We must take bold action on climate change. That’s why that@RepDonBeyer and I are introducing the Healthy Climate and Family Security Act. This bill requires polluters to pay and returns the proceeds to families in the form of a dividend. Learn more:.

Good news: The Senate Budget Committee voted in favor of my amendment to tackle the rising cost of prescription drug costs during today’s markup. I’m pleased we were able to agree on a bipartisan basis that we must help Americans struggling to afford lifesaving medicine.

Republicans on the Budget Committee just voted down my amendment to return the estate tax to the level it was prior to the Trump Tax Scam—which exempts estates worth up to $22M—and use that revenue to ↓ taxes for middle-class families who had a Trump tax increase.

Oh hey, would you look that… if the President would cut back on a few trips to Mar-a-Lago to hit up the omelet bar and play golf, Secretary DeVos wouldn’t have to cut federal funding from the Special Olympics. This is shameful https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/03/27/five-trump-trips-mar-a-lago-would-cover-betsy-devoss-proposed-special-olympics-cuts/?utm_term=.10700b12832b ….

The #ForThePeople Act would get rid of millions of dollars of secret money in politics and protect the right to vote. Instead of engaging in cynical political games, Mitch McConnell should bring it to a vote immediately.

Good news! Because of our outreach,@NatlParkService and@USDOTFHWA are starting emergency repairs on the Baltimore-Washington Parkway. I asked them to take immediate action, and I want to thank them for working with us. Soon, Marylanders can return to a safe, reliable commute https://twitter.com/MacFarlaneNews/status/1106628801482629123 ….

….. but his Justice Department launched a full-fledged attack on the entire Affordable Care Act today—including the provision that protects people with pre-existing conditions. A lie is a lie no matter what branch of government you serve in https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1110651387690524672 ….

Days ago, McConnell said he wanted “as much openness and transparency as possible” in regards to the Mueller report. How quickly he’s changed his tune. This week, he blocked our resolution calling upon the Attorney General to make it public. RT to demand transparency!

Senator McConnell: Democrats recognize the reality of the science behind climate change and the urgent need to tackle this crisis. Meanwhile, your caucus continues to sit on its hands, doing nothing while the harm and costs rise all around us. Stop these political stunts.

Yesterday, we found out that stock buybacks have reached their fourth straight quarterly record. Instead of investing in workers, the Trump Tax Scam has just produced over $900B in buybacks for corporate executives. Watch today's hearing to learn more https://www.pscp.tv/ChrisVanHollen/1yoJMjyymNkxQ ….

When Trump was sworn-in, he reinstated the global gag rule to deny women info about reproductive health care. Pompeo’s policy is an expansion of this. It’s not enough for them to wreak havoc on our health care system, they want to go global with their know-nothing approach https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1110535419404476417 ….
The American people have a right to see the results of the Mueller report. We deserve #transparency – the rule of law depends on it.
Our oyster sanctuaries are working. And now they are permanent https://twitter.com/baltimoresun/status/1115300792095911939 ….

We are hearing more about how last year’s tax bill has hurt many Marylanders and others across the country who are feeling the sting of changes in deductions that have left taxes to pay in April. We want bipartisan changes to make the tax code fairer, esp for working families https://twitter.com/senatorcardin/status/1115268106023309315 ….

In the final count down to #TaxDay2019 I’m at the #IRS in New Carrollton with@SenatorRonWyden for a townhall with federal workers. We’re talking tax policy, taking questions and thanking these dedicated public servants for their work.

We have lost a dear friend and our hearts are broken while we mourn with his wife, his family, and his dedicated staff at the State Capitol.

May his memory be a blessing to his family and all of those whom his life touched https://twitter.com/senatorcardin/status/1114997427881291776 ….

A sad day for Maryland as we mourn the loss of our friend@SpeakerBusch... Mike Busch was a force in Annapolis and he left a progressive imprint on the state that without hyperbole will last for generations. For me, and for Myrna, the loss is intensely personal.
Praying alongside all of Maryland https://twitter.com/capgaznews/status/1114926066433503234 ….

Joining seniors@clvillagemd to discuss health care, infrastructure and environmental priorities. Hearing from many Marylanders who want real protections for #PreExistingConditions, #CleanWater. – at Carroll Lutheran Village.

Sharing memories this morning with Professor Herb Smith@McDanielCollege and meeting with an energetic, well-informed group of students. Always a great day to visit Downtown Westminster@CarrollCoMD. – at Hoover Library.
“Of all the forms of inequality, injustice in health care is the most shocking and inhumane.” #MLK51.
“If you can’t fly then run, if you can’t run then walk, if you can’t walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.” #MLK51.

Words to consider on this 51st anniversary of the assassination of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. “An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity.” #ThursdayThoughts #MLK51.

Short-term political gain = long-term damage to the Senate and our nation. #formerlytheworldsgreatestdeliberativebod https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mitch-mcconnell-undid-213-years-of-senate-history-in-33-minutes/2019/04/03/58b3eaca-565c-11e9-9136-f8e636f1f6df_story.html?utm_term=.c54eba427775&wpisrc=nl_daily202&wpmm=1 ….

Trending right now, #AvengersEndgame is only slightly higher than #EqualPayDay... In real life, we can make a real difference in the lives of women and families across America by finally passing the #PaycheckFairnessAct and making the #paygap vanish.

The Trump DOJ’s decision to destroy the ACA puts millions of Americans, especially those with pre-existing conditions, at risk. I strongly agree with@SenatorShaheen who said that Republicans must start defending their constituents instead of their President. #ProtectOurCare.

The efforts of the Trump DOJ to repeal ACA and protections of Americans w/ pre-existing conditions is nothing short of an assault on the American public. Health care is a human right; not another line on a list of empty campaign promises. #ProtectOurCar https://www.healthline.com/health-news/what-to-know-about-pre-existing-conditions-with-aca-in-danger#Higher-out-of-pocket-costs ….

The Republican “plan” for health care puts millions of Americans risk. On #WorldAutismDay we recognize the need to support Americans w/ pre-existing conditions to receive the care they deserve under a health care system that represents the values of this nation. #ProtectOurCare.

There is no logical reason that men and women are paid different wages for the same work. Congress can work to close the #paygap #EqualPayDa https://thekojonnamdishow.org/shows/2019-04-02/what-the-gender-pay-gap-looks-like-in-the-washington-region ….

Maryland women are making $0.86 cents for every dollar a man earns. If the gender wage gap were closed in MD, and in states around the country, it would cut the poverty rate for working women in half and add nearly a half trillion dollars to our economy https://www.aauw.org/resource/gender-pay-gap-by-state-and-congressional-district/ ….

How a nation treats its women – economically and socially—is a sign of that nation’s success. The wage disparity between American men and women is hurting our nation. The Senate must take up and pass the Paycheck Fairness Act. #EqualPayDay.

It supports programs to fight gangs and drug trafficking. It combats corruption. It creates educational and economic opportunities that benefit both the U.S. and local economies. Most of this assistance supports the work of non-profit and faith-based organizations.

This assistance enjoys widespread, bipartisan support because it directly fights the instability that drives people to leave their homes in the first place. Contrary to the Trump Administration’s rhetoric, foreign assistance is not a handout to foreign govts. #CentralAmerica.

The decision to stop foreign assistance to Central America actively undermines the security interests of the United States. It is reckless and counterproductive https://www.cardin.senate.gov/newsroom/press/release/cardin-calls-trump-move-to-cut-off-aid-to-central-american-countries-reckless-and-counterproductive ….
Great meeting today with Maryland's congressional delegation and Governor Hogan. Making progress on regional transportation priorities and protecting the Chesapeake Bay.

Most Americans believe the #ERA is already a part of the U.S. Constitution—and I don’t blame them. It’s unconscionable that, in 2019, men and women are STILL not considered equal under the Constitution. I’m fighting to change that. #ERANow.

The president made the right decision by extending legal protections for another year for Liberians under the Deferred Enforced Departure (DED) program. Transgender individuals deserve respect & equality in our military, in schools and everywhere else. During #TransVisibilityWeek, we recognize the community’s contributions to our country, their courage & dignity. 
I'm proud to stand against hate and prejudice. You #WontBeErased.

I applaud my colleagues in the House for passing HR 124 to denounce President Trump’s discriminatory #TransMilitaryBan. Transgender service members are brave patriots who fight to protect our nation’s freedoms abroad. We must protect their freedoms at home. #ProtectTransTroops.

This is not about bragging rights. This is not about the Republican Party.
This is about the millions of Americans who will not be able to afford preventative screenings, prescription drugs, or mental health care. Yet you refuse to listen@POTUS. We need the #ACA.

Once again President Trump is breaking his promise to the American people. Access to affordable care should not be a debate. Health care is a human right. Period. 

We will fight for the #ACA. We will fight for you https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1110979158178451458 ….

Voting is a fundamental right of citizenship. Yet the U.S. is one of few Western democracies that allows permanent denial of voting rights for individuals with felony convictions. It’s simply wrong that state disenfranchisement laws deny citizens participation in our democracy.

I’m proud to join Sen. Udall to co-sponsor the #ForThePeopleAct, which would eliminate the patchwork of voter rights across the country. Among many important measures, this bill includes my #DemocracyRestorationAct, which would restore voting rights to returning citizens https://twitter.com/SenatorTomUdall/status/1110891967075008512 ….

An “Irish Exit” (Irish Goodbye) is when you leave quietly without saying goodbye or telling anyone. A “British Exit” is when you loudly announce that you’re leaving and then wander in and out while you decide if you really want to leave or not, angrily complaining the whole time.
